meanings.definition: Crossing or extending across the Atlantic Ocean.
meanings.sent1: The transatlantic flight was long but exciting.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the transatlantic cruise with her family.
meanings.sent3: The transatlantic journey felt like a grand adventure.
meanings.sent4: Their transatlantic bond was unbreakable, despite the distance.
meanings.sent5: The transatlantic view from the plane was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Relating to or situated on the other side of the Atlantic Ocean.
meanings.sent1: The transatlantic trade route was crucial for business.
meanings.sent2: He had a transatlantic pen pal who lived in Europe.
meanings.sent3: The transatlantic relationship added an element of mystery.
meanings.sent4: Their transatlantic connection was like a bridge between continents.
meanings.sent5: The transatlantic culture exchange enriched their lives.
